VII.iii.1.A.1.k
.
Apportionments Involving a Beneficiary or Claimant That Resides in a Foreign Country
Any regional office (RO) may process an apportionment claim as long as the
beneficiary
is not a foreign resident.  The residency of the
claimant
is irrelevant in this case.
Only the ROs identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 3.A.2.a
, may process an apportionment claim if the
beneficiary
is a foreign resident.
Reference
:  For more information on handling cases in which the primary beneficiary or claimant resides in a foreign country, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 3.B
.
